title: How to Manually Reset a Blink Camera to Fix Common Issues

steps.title: Turn off power completely.
steps.content: Turn off power completely. If your Blink camera is connected to electric wires (for example, the Blink Video Doorbell), turn off power to the doorbell chime by switching off the related circuit breaker. Otherwise, there is an electric shock hazard risk. [1] X Research source If you’re just getting started, see our guides on installing a security camera system and hiding security cameras outside .

steps.title: Remove the battery cover.
steps.content: Remove the battery cover. Different cameras have different methods for removing the battery cover. [2] X Research source Blink Video Doorbell — Insert the Opening Key into the back cover slot to release the catch. Outdoor and Indoor (Gen 2) — Detach the camera from mounts and accessories. Then, using the opening tool or a coin to unfasten the back cover. XT2 and XT — Slide the gray switch in the direction of the arrow symbol. Indoor (Gen 1) — Move the latch on the bottom of the camera. Note that the Blink Mini doesn’t use batteries. To power cycle the Mini, unplug it, wait 10 seconds, then reinsert the plug.

steps.title: Remove the batteries.
steps.content: Remove the batteries. Then, wait 10 seconds before putting them back in. [3] X Research source This will power cycle the camera and potentially resolve the issue.

steps.title: Unplug the Sync Module.
steps.content: Unplug the Sync Module. Remove the power cord from the back of the module. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wait 10 seconds.
steps.content: Wait 10 seconds. This is part of the power cycle process to resolve issues.

steps.title: Plug the power cord in.
steps.content: Plug the power cord in. This will reboot the Sync Module. Look for the indicator light to turn blue, then green. It will blink green if it’s ready for setup.

steps.title: Locate the reset button.
steps.content: Locate the reset button. This method applies to Blink cameras and Sync Modules. The button is typically on the bottom side of the device. For example, the Blink Mini has a reset button under the camera body, next to its stand. [5] X Research source If you can’t locate the reset button, check your device’s manual for more information. If your Blink camera doesn’t have a reset button, try the battery removal method above.

steps.title: Press and hold the button for more than 5 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the button for more than 5 seconds. This will reset the camera. Use something that isn’t sharp, like a paperclip or small screwdriver. Red and blue indicator lights will flash before the button is released. Then, the light will slowly blink blue. This means the camera is ready to connect to a Blink system. The Sync Module will blink blue then turn solid green. Then, it’s ready to be added using the Blink app. Note, this won’t reset the camera settings to default or delete it from an account.
